name: Courtyard St Petersburg Vasilievsky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed 3 nights here. Had taken overnight train in, so arrived at hotel around 10 in the morning. Luckily, the extremely friendly desk clerk checked us in. Room had a fantastic river view and of the stadium across river. Hotel seems really new - everything is clean, modern with a Scandinavian feel/decor to it. Beds were very comfortable, flat-screen TV, apartment-like windows, mini-fridge (empty so you can stock yourself), nice closet and drawer space. We did get a good rate here during White Nights. Weather was good, so we usually walked from city centre to hotel (around 20 minutes fast walking). Or, Metro is a 10-minute walk, then 1 stop away from Nevsky station. Bought water, snacks from "snack stand" behind desk few times. Convenient. Only drawback is distance from Nevsky Prospekt, but worked OK for us. Definitely would recommend this hotel. We were very happy with our stay.
reviews.title: Clean, modern hotel - great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brand new, clean, great sheets and towels. Modern bath. Nice flat screen TV in the room. The bar and restaurant were great. In spite of other reviews, I found the staff friendly and helpful. 10 minute walk to the subway. At $203 a night, one of the best values in St. Petersburg
reviews.title: This is a great hotel

reviews.text: This hotel opened in October and looks like the front desk staff are still being trained. A bit slow. Having said that, by Russian standards the service in this hotel is good and the bar staff and concierge in partic were really helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: good value hotel by St Pete standard prices

reviews.text: The price we paid was high but a third of what we would have paid in my first choice hotels where I tend to stay usually (Europa and Kempinski -and maybe Renaissance but for latter only due to location) which had gone into cloud cuckoo land re rates they wanted. White nights- ok, but when we were there grey and raining nights so not worth a huge hike in prices. If you can get a good rate this is worth a go. The location is not great with not much around it- however it is a mere 5- 10 mins taxi ride to the centre from where most main sites are in walking distance. (watch the rip off taxis tho and barter even with the official ones...) so this is not really a problem and there is also a metro stop nearby which is 1 or 2 stops away from the centre and very cheap.
reviews.title: new and modern hotel with poor service

reviews.text: My room was spacious and had an iron, coffee machine and a decent bathroom. I stay in a lot of Marriotts and would have to say tho this does not really look or feel like a Marriott. Whatever happened to the famous Marriott bed/s? not any in this hotel. And the decor looks very russian as opposed to Marriott conservative but smart interiors I am used to incl at Courtyards (altho the hotels in China were ultra swish and modern so their recent hotels can look cool too). My bet is the franchise partner picked the carpet, curtains etc as i doubt Marriott would....
reviews.title: THE place to stay in St.Petersburg

likes.liked: — Quality of service, espacially with comparisson to other St.Petersburh hotels

description: Courtyard St. Petersburg Vasilievsky hotel has a perfect location in the historic city centre of charming St. Petersburg, Russia. Whether you accommodate for business or choose the hotel for vacation the Courtyard by Marriott St. Petersburg Vasilievsky will contribute to making your visit more memorable and comfortable. You will surely appreciate the location, its modern design, the view to the River Neva and free broadband Internet in the public areas. The Courtyard St. Petersburg Vasilievsky hotel offers 214 spacious accommodations and suites with comfortable bedding, large work desk and broadband Internet.
